logic.piece

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.piece.Piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StandardJunglePiece

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is responsible for modeling a piece.
    Author:
    Andrei Letavin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Coordinate _location
      The location of this Piece instance on the board
      protected java.lang.String _name
      The name of this Piece instance

      The rank of this Piece instance
      protected int _side
      The value for the side that this Piece instance belongs to
      protected int _speed
      The speed of this Piece instance
      protected int _usualRank
      The usual rank this Piece instance should have, without any modifications

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece(int side,
             int speed,
             int usualRank,
             java.lang.String name)
        Builds a piece with the given parameters. Note: _location can only be set after creation through the use of a mutator.
        Parameters:
        side - Represents the side a piece belongs to.
        speed - Represents the speed of a piece.
        usualRank - Represents the usual rank of a piece (before conditions such as trap squares influence it).
        name - A string representing the name of a given piece.

    • Method Detail

      • canTakePiece

        public abstract boolean canTakePiece(Piece tryingToTake)
        Defines the method that is used to determine if this piece can take another.
        Parameters:
        tryingToTake - The piece we are trying to take.
        Returns:
        true if this piece can take tryingToTake and false otherwise.

      • getSide

        public int getSide()
        Returns the side a piece belongs to.
        Returns:
        The value to set the pieces _side to.

      • setSide

        public void setSide(int side)
        Sets the side the piece is on to whatever argument is passed in. No validation is done.
        Parameters:
        side - The value to set the piece's _side to.

        public int getSpeed()
